channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Brittany Murphy's friends and family reveal desperate attempts to stop her wedding
item.description: The couple's relationship and the conspiracy theories surrounding their deaths will be explored in the HBO Max documentary What Happed to Brittany Murphy?

item.title: Costco and Walmart limit toilet paper as supply chain problems worsen
item.description: The goods exist, but backlogs at shipping yards and rail yards across the country combined with a lack of workers means the items aren't being offloaded quickly enough.

item.title: Tom Cruise face: Top Gun star's changing appearance causes Twitter stir
item.description: Cruise, 59, was enjoying a night out at Oracle Park to watch the San Francisco Giants play the Los Angeles Dodgers with his son Connor, 26, by his side.

item.title: Ministers broker deal to keep UK's CO2 industry afloat
item.description: The Government has brokered a deal with the carbon dioxide industry to ensure vital supplies of CO2 continue amid fears higher production costs will inevitably be passed onto consumers.

item.title: Tory MP James Gray said 'They all look the same to me' about Nadhim Zahawi and Sajid Javid
item.description: Tory MP James Gray was tonight fighting for his political life over a racism scandal - after he declared two of his party's Asian ministers Nadhim Zahawi and Sajid Javid 'look the same to me'.

item.title: Superman comes out as BISEXUAL: DC Comics reveals son of Clark Kent is dating a man
item.description: DC Comics announced the news on Monday, revealing that Jonathan 'Jon' Kent, who took over the Superman title from his father Clark, will soon start dating close friend Jay Nakamura.

item.title: Amanda Staveley, 48, glamorous financier who brought blood money in the Premiership?
item.description: The 48-year-old willowy blonde is at the centre of a political storm this week after she helped a Saudi-Arabian backed consortium bought the Premier League club from Mike Ashley.

item.title: A mural by Banksy has appeared overnight on the wall of a Stockport pub in Greater Manchester
item.description: Banksy may have struck again as a mural (pictured) in the renowned street artist's style was spotted on the side of a pub (pictured inset) in Greater Manchester.

item.title: Solar storm is due to hit Earth TODAY and could cause havoc for power grids
item.description: The UK's Met Office and the US's National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration have forecasted a coronal mass ejection - a massive expulsion of plasma from the Sun's corona.

item.title: William Shatner is 'deeply disappointed' by the one day delay of the Blue Origin mission
item.description: William Shatner told GMA he is 'deeply disappointed' the Blue Origin mission has been delayed. He, Chris Boshuizen, Glen de Vries and Audrey Powers will now launch Wed at 8:30am.

item.title: Ransomware 'presents the most immediate danger to the UK'
item.description: Businesses in particular need to do more to protect themselves, said National Cyber Security Centre chief Lindy Cameron, who was speaking at Chatham House's Cyber 2021 Conference.
item.media:description: Ransomware attacks present `the most immediate danger´ to the UK, the head of the National Cyber Security Centre has said, with cyber attacks linked to the Covid-19 pandemic also likely to be prevalent for many years to come (Yui Mok/PA)

item.title: Fears thousands of jobs will go at factories hammered by soaring energy costs
item.description: Kwasi Kwarteng has officially asked for funding after the Treasury dealt him an extraordinary slapdown yesterday by denying his claims they were in talks about a package.

item.title: Son, 37, who tried to murder parents and grandmother at their £700,000 home locked up in hospital
item.description: Jonathan Keal told his mother 'this isn't me, it's the devil' as he tried to stab her with a pair of scissors and repeatedly apologised as he beat his family with a cricket bat in a horrifying attack.

item.title: Married couple say they are 'truly sorry' for 'cheating' the London Marathon
item.description: Monika Czarnecka, 41 and her husband Piotr, 42 were photographed running together during the London Marathon wearing the same registration number on their vests.

item.title: Disqualified van driver jailed for running over and killing WW2 hero, 95
item.description: Ex-paratrooper Alonzo Smart, 95, was walking home with his shopping in Fordham, Cambridgeshire, when he was hit by van driver Ricardas Prismantas while crossing a road.

item.title: Lottery player in London has just over two weeks to claim £1million prize
item.description: A customer, who bought the winning ticket in London, has yet to claim their prize after scooping the EuroMillions UK Millionaire Maker cash worth £1million.

item.title: Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin has 'bro culture that makes it a hostile workplace for women'
item.description: Blue Origin, founded by Jeff Bezos and run by his CEO, Bob Smith (seen far left with Bezos), fired ex-executive Walt McCleery (inset) after women complained he made them feel uncomfortable.

item.title: Doctors unable to find cause of death for England fan who died celebrating Harry Kane goal at Euros
item.description: Charlie Naughton, from Hammersmith, jumped to celebrate Harry Kane's header before he fell to the ground and hit his head. Doctors have not been able to determine the cause of death.

item.title: Care worker 'was slapped on the bottom, shown an ISIS film and accused of being a terrorist'
item.description: The care worker, who is of Somali origin, was slapped on the bottom and shown the Netflix film Layla M, which centres around a young Muslim girl who is radicalised in Amsterdam, by her boss.

item.title: Couple flying to Vegas stunned to find their chihuahua hiding in their suitcase at check-in
item.description: Jared and Kristi Owens were flying out of Lubbock, about 300 mi west of Forth Worth, when they were told their baggage was overweight on September 26. What they found inside stunned them.

item.title: Terrifying video shows unwitting girl, 16, being STRANGLED from behind by a homeless woman
item.description: Shocking security footage shows the moment a homeless woman accosts a 16-year-old girl and attempts to strangle her from behind outside a popular Sushi restaurant in New York.

item.title: Elon Musk tells shareholders he wants to build Tesla factories on Mars in the next 40 years
item.description: Elon Musk told Tesla shareholders that he would like to build cars on the Red Planet sometime in the next 40 years or so, before the world's richest man dies.

item.title: State Department praises the Taliban for being 'candid and professional' in talks
item.description: State Department representatives met with Taliban leaders on Sunday, and spokesman Ned Price praised the talks as 'candid and professional.'

item.title: Boston Dynamic's robot canine Spot has a future as a guard dog that can boost safety and efficiency
item.description: Boston Dynamics engineer Zack Jackowski says Spot can collect data in plants, utilities [and] installations, and develop ways to boost safety and efficiency that have have never been considered before.

item.title: Saudi Arabia gave Trump FAKE white tiger and cheetah fur coats and possibly illegal ivory dagger
item.description: Expensive furs given to Trump by the Saudi royal family on his first presidential trip are fake, a report revealed on Monday. They and an ivory dagger were flagged as possibly illegal.

item.title: Want to lose this winter? Go wild swimming, study suggests
item.description: Danish researchers recruited eight cold water swimmers and eight people who did not take the chilly dips. They found cold water swimmers had a lower pulse and reduced blood pressure.

item.title: Detective denies 'unconscious bias' in investigation of killer Stephen Port's first victim
item.description: Ex-police officer Chris Jones attended the scene of Anthony Walgate's death in east London and determined the death was unexplained rather than suspicious but has denied an 'unconscious bias'

item.title: Steve Jobs' model daughter Eve, 23, is named a Tatler It Girl
item.description: Eve Jobs, the 23-year-old daughter of late Apple billionaire Steve, who was named one of the 'new generation of IT girls' by society bible Tatler' after making her runway debut at Paris Fashion Week.

item.title: Pen Farthing tells of relief after dozens of staff members flew to UK from his Afghan animal shelter
item.description: Former Royal Marine Paul 'Pen' Farthing said members of staff at the Nowzad animal shelter in Afghanistan have been flying into the UK from Islamabad, Pakistan, over the last month.

item.title: A woman who fell asleep on the train describes how a 'weirdo' man she didn't know sat next to he
item.description: Taking to twitter, Sabrina Aloueche from London, explained how she had been travelling back to the city from Wales when she fell asleep. She woke up to find a man opposite her at the table and panicked

item.title: Putin denies he has COVID-19 after coughing through meeting with officials
item.description: Russian president Vladimir Putin told officials he underwent tests on a daily basis and 'everything was fine' after a speaker of the upper house of parliament asked about his condition.

item.title: Economists warn 'groupthink' is stopping Bank of England lifting interest rates
item.description: Andrew Sentance, a former Monetary Policy Committee member, said he was 'a bit surprised' there are not more voices at the Bank calling for rates to be eased up soon.

item.title: Sofas built out of pallets, kitchen full of supplies and their own BAR: Inside the anti-HS2 camp
item.description: Protesters including veteran activist Swampy were this morning holed up in tunnels dug under land in Aylesbury in a renewed attempt to halt the HS2 trainline.

item.title: Julia Bradbury reveals she has had her mastectomy as she shares photo of herself in hospital bed
item.description: Julia Bradbury, 51, revealed on Monday that she has had a mastectomy.

item.title: Downing Street: No target for return of civil servants to Whitehall offices
item.description: Downing Street today said targets will not be set for the return of civil servants to Whitehall despite Boris Johnson urging the nation to ditch working from home.

item.title: 1898 magazine depiction of how London will look is 'scarily accurate'
item.description: Charlotte Hume, from Kensington Olympia, London, shared a pictured from Pearson's Weekly to her Twitter account Back in Time West London.

item.title: Historian says Spartans - whose battle against the Persians was immortalised in 300 - usually LOST
item.description: According to legend, King Leonidas I of Sparta led a group of 300 warriors who held off hundreds of thousands of Persian invaders under Great King Xerxes in the Battle of Thermopylae in 480 BC.

item.title: Three bear cubs tip each other on to the ground as they try to struggle to get into a hammock
item.description: Three bear cubs tried to climb into a hammock in the Smoky Mountains before it flipped. A family filmed the trio after being alerted by noises outside their vacation cabin near Gatlinburg, Tennessee.

item.title: Black Death is able to reach more areas due to global warming, Russia's top doctor warns
item.description: Russian doctor Dr Anna Popova has warned of the threat posed by the Black Death, claiming its return was a 'risk' to public health because of global warming.

item.title: Police officer could lose his job after travelling 20 miles from home during Covid restrictions
item.description: Mark Lee, 43, had travelled 20 miles to Cwm Idwal with his partner and her autistic child on December 29 last year, when Wales was an Alert Tier 4 area.
item.media:credit: Â© Andrew Price / View Finder Pi

item.title: Lucy Dyer charged with death by dangerous driving after tot Eva Maria Sorin killed in Llanelli crash
item.description: Lucy Dyer, 23, was behind the wheel of a BMW when she smashed into a family car with baby Eva Maria Sorin died after inside in a child seat in Llanelli, South Wales in a 20mph zone on Friday night, a court heard.

item.title: Baby is found sitting in his parents' blood after the teenage couple were shot dead in Brazil
item.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT. Nicolas Elias Albuquerque do Prado, 18, and Cleidiana Pereira Alixandre, 19, were allegedly shot by two men on a motorcycle in Alto Garcas, Brazil.

item.title: Steel industry boss blasts PM's family getaway at millionaire minister's £25k-a-night estate
item.description: Downing Street has insisted the Prime Minister remains in full control of the country despite whisking Carrie and Wilfred off on a sunshine getaway at an opulent Costa del Sol villa.

item.title: Britain's daily Covid cases jump by 15% in a week as outbreak continues to grow
item.description: Department of Health figures showed 40,224 Covid cases were recorded today, which was up 15 per cent on the same time last week. It marks the sixth day in a row they have risen.

item.title: Musk 'roasts' rival billionaire Bezos with a single emoji after becoming world's richest man
item.description: Jeff Bezos shared the front page of Barron's magazine from 1999 which described him as silly. But Elon Musk took a jab at him by replying a No.2 medal emoji after becoming richest man.

item.title: Pfizer will vaccinate EVERYONE over age 12 in one Brazilian city to study how long protection lasts
item.description: Researchers say the study will be a opportunity to examine the safety of the vaccine, how long protection lasts and if it's effective against new variants in a 'real-world setting.'

item.title: ITV apologises after Freeview users are unable to access its channels
item.description: According to DownDetector, the problems started at about 15:00 BST and affected viewers across the UK for around 45 minutes. ITV said the service had now resumed.

item.title: China warns Taiwan will have 'no choice but to take it to the battlefield'
item.description: China's state-backed Global Times issued the threat Sunday, after Taiwan's President Tsai gave a speech vowing to defend the island's democratic way of life against Beijing's 'threats'.

item.title: Brazil's unvaccinated president angry at missed soccer game
item.description: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro complained he missed the Santos-Gremio soccer game in São Paulo on Sunday because he is not vaccinated against COVID-19.

item.title: Tesla Cybertruck to go into 'volume production' in 2023
item.description: Addressing shareholders at Tesla's annual meeting last week, Musk said 'several supply chain shortages' have likely delayed outputs of the electric pick-up beyond 2022.

item.title: Moment two moped riders burst into shop and threaten customers before hurling chair at window
item.description: The incident, outside the Au Ciel Patisserie, in Dulwich, London, happened at about 10.30am on Sunday and resulted in four police cars and 14 officers being sent to the scene.

item.title: Amazon reveals its top ten most desirable toys for Christmas 2021
item.description: With the festive season fast approaching, Amazon has revealed its top ten toys for Christmas 2021. From fantasy to film, this year's selection are sure to keep children of all ages entertained.

item.title: Downing Street 'welcomes' plan for 888 'walk me home' emergency number to protect lone women
item.description: The service has been proposed by BT chief executive Philip Jansen in response to public outrage over the murder of Sarah Everard .

item.title: Teachers are told not to read out the N-word when teaching To Kill A Mockingbird and Of Mice And Men
item.description: More than 100 academics, campaigners and parents have signed a letter sent challenging the reading out of the racial slur used in To Kill a Mockingbird and Of Mice and Men.

item.title: Has Liz Truss won the tussle with Raab over Chevening?
item.description: A laughing Foreign Secretary Liz Truss welcomed counterparts from Baltic states for talks at the Kent estate today.

item.title: Double-jabbed mother, 28, dies from sepsis following surgery as she fought long battle against Covid
item.description: Ruth McCamon, from Kilmarnock, had been battling Covid in hospital and was put on a ventilator despite already having both jabs. She died on Thursday after developing sepsis.

item.title: Girl, 15, branded 'lab rat' by anti-vaxxers when she went for jab at vaccination centre in Wales
item.description: Grace Baker-Earle, 15, developed chronic fatigue syndrome (ME) which is a long-term illness that is commonly associated with extreme tiredness, after a battle with Covid-19 and now uses a wheelchair.

item.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody: Witness recalls hearing his friend being raped by Luton paedophile
item.description: Tonight's episode of C4's 24 Hours in Police Custody is the first in a two-part episode about the case of Carson Grimes, 65, who raped and sexually assaulted vulnerable young children.

item.title: Liz Truss hits out at trans rights mob harassing university professor
item.description: Equalities minister Liz Truss has backed the feminist professor at the centre of a row over her view on transgender rights - declaring 'No one should be targeted and harassed simply for holding opinion'.

item.title: Grieving husband blames death of his cancer-stricken wife on GP refusing to make a home visit
item.description: The father-of-three begged a GP to come to make a home visit to his 44-year-old wife who was in 'severe pain' and by the time she made it to hospital the cancer had spread to her brain.

item.title: Fury over rise of the 'part-time' GP (who still earns £100,000 a year)
item.description: Data from a Government-backed study shows the average GP - who earns £100,000 a year - is now working 6.6 sessions each week, following a startling drop in working hours.

item.title: Sajid Javid and Nadhim Zahawi pen letter to parents urging them to get their children vaccinated
item.description: The plea for children to get jabbed comes after one in 12 pupils in England aged 11 to 16 were thought to have been infected on October 2, according to estimates from the Office for National Statistics.
item.media:description: High school pupil Molly Rowe gets her jab at Fernhill community centre in Rutherglen, South Lanarkshire (Andrew Milligan/PA)

item.title: Video shows 'accident waiting to happen' at the Bolshoi where actor was crushed to death
item.description: Performers are seen fleeing during a rehearsal as the mechanism lowering the backdrop appears to malfunction. It wobbles and collides with other pieces of setting as it is lowered.

item.title: Five neutral pain colours perfect any room in the house
item.description: Leading interior designer Alexander James Interiors recommends five different paint colours to use in various rooms around the house.

item.title: Tributes are paid to 'exceptional' police dog Mij whose drug-finding fame saw him star in TV series
item.description: Mij, an English springer spaniel, spent nine years with Nottinghamshire Police and sniffed out drugs worth hundreds of thousands of pounds during his time with the force.

item.title: Iraqi forces detain Islamic State's finance chief who had $5million US bounty on his head
item.description: Sami Jasim al-Jaburi, the suspected former deputy to the late IS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, was arrested 'in Turkey', according to a senior Iraqi military source.

item.title: Airbus' solar-powered aircraft Zephyr completes two 18-day flights
item.description: Zephyr's second test touched down on September 13 in Arizona, in a demonstration for the Ministry of Defence (MoD), Airbus confirmed today.

item.title: Kim Jong Un wears sandals and socks as he orders officials to tackle North Korea's difficulties
item.description: The dictator, 37, strutted up the red carpet of a lavish hall wearing what appeared to be black sandals which he bizarrely paired with black socks beneath his formal dark suit and burgundy necktie.

item.title: Child exploitation survivor shares her story
item.description: Aliyah Morgan, now 24, was born to a drug user father and grew up surrounded by domestic abuse in a house in south London. She speaks on BBC documentary Hidden Girls.

item.title: Police officer, 44, accused of killing teen footballer, 18, 'lost sight of risk he was creating'
item.description: Former Crystal Palace youth player Lewis Johnson, 18, crashed while being pursued by PC Paul Summerson, 44, through the streets of east London , on the morning of 9 February 2016.

item.title: Prince Albert applied for 'sovereign immunity' in paternity court battle
item.description: Lawyer Erich Grmaldi, who is acting on behalf of a Brazilian woman who claims Prince Albert, 63, fathered her daughter, told Town&Country the case would be in court 'imminently.'

item.title: Romeo jet skier breaks his finger after being flattened while taking a selfie at Giant's Causeway
item.description: Dale Mclaughlan, 29, visited the iconic rock formation near Bushmills, Northern Ireland, with his friend Arron Martin, 28. Viewed more than 150,000 times, the stunt was met with backlash online.

item.title: Paediatrician struck off after he asked female colleague to help him write Fifty Shades of Grey book
item.description: Dr Muhammad Asghar had been making advances towards the woman for two years, writing her love notes and bought a Ted Baker love heart necklace for her, a disciplinary hearing was told.

item.title: Rescuers search for seal that got its mouth stuck on a discarded Red Bull can in Northern Ireland
item.description: Onlookers alerted lifeboat teams after the seal was spotted with the empty drink can. Lagan Search and Rescue and Debbie Doolittle's Wild Life are involved with the rescue.

item.title: UK and Ireland clash over Northern Ireland Protocol ahead of major speech by Lord Frost tomorrow
item.description: Brexit Minister Lord Frost is to give a speech tomorrow in which he will demand removing the role of the European Court of Justice (ECJ) in administering the Northern Ireland Protocol.

item.title: Huge 1,500-year-old WINE FACTORY discovered in Israel
item.description: The sophisticated facility, unearthed in Yavne, could produce up to two million litres of wine per year, according to the Israel Antiquities Authority.

item.title: Simple blood test could tell if you're going to be struck down with dementia in the next five years
item.description: Scientists at the German Centre for Neurodegenerative Diseases say they have now identified three biomarkers that may be able to diagnose the disease early.

item.title: Soldier, 24, becomes SEVENTH generation of his family to serve in the Army
item.description: Second Lieutenant Alexander James Stewart Cartwright (pictured with his father Brigadier Stephen Cartwright), 24, graduated from Sandhurst earlier this year.

item.title: Social media users turn traditional Christmas trees into spooky Halloween centrepieces
item.description: Enthusiasts of all things spooky from around the world have took to Instagram to share their spectacular centrepieces as they turned their festive firs into scary masterpieces.

item.title: World's most powerful radio antenna detects mysterious signals from 19 distant stars
item.description: Of the 19 radio signals detected, at least four match what is expected from a planet, say astronomers from the University of Queensland, Australia.

item.title: Archaeology: Burnt seeds from an ancient fireplace in Utah show humans used tobacco 12,300 years ago
item.description: The seeds were unearthed at the 'Wishbone' hunter-gatherer site in Utah's Great Salt Lake Desert by experts led from the Far Western Anthropological Research Group.

item.title: Kremlin dismisses 'unscientific' claims that Russia STOLE blueprint for the Oxford/AstraZeneca jab
item.description: Putin's presidential spokesman Dmitry Peskov today dismissed the claims that a Russian spy stole the blueprints for the Oxford/AstraZeneca Covid-19 vaccine to develop the Sputnik V jab.

item.title: AstraZeneca's antibody cocktail can both prevent AND treat Covid, trial data shows
item.description: A new Covid treatment where artificially created antibodies are injected into patients are could help both treat and prevent severe cases, and even death, of the virus, according to trial data.

item.title: Scream's Ghostface wields a bloody dagger in very-first poster for the fifth installment
item.description: In a photo posted to the film's Twitter account on Sunday, the iconic Ghostface wielded a bloody dagger.

item.title: 'Recipe for a heart attack!': James Martin's chicken Milanese recipe horrifies viewers
item.description: James Martin, 49, who recently released a cookbook titled Butter, appeared on This Morning's food segment today where he demonstrated his recipe for chicken Milanese.

item.title: Al Capone's treasure trove of heirlooms sells for $3.1m
item.description: The collection, sold by his granddaughters, included personalized jewelry, photographs and furniture, and a tender letter written to his only child Sonny from Alcatraz Prison.

item.title: Unvaccinated people have 97% reduced risk at contracting COVID-19 as family members get immune
item.description: Swedish researchers from Umeå University found that having a higher amount of immune people in someone's family can reduce their risk of infection by up to 97 percent.

item.title: Mother-of-two told she has terminal cancer after op was CANCELLED due to Covid
item.description: Kelly Pendry, from north Wales, has vowed to battle the disease 'make memories' for her two children Sam and Isla, and to warn other women who may be in her position.

item.title: Princess Charlene of Monaco's final operation 'went very well', palace source says
item.description: The operation in South Africa on Friday was performed under general anaesthetic, and 'is the last she had to undergo following her ENT infection,' the source told French news agency AFP.

item.title: Moment mass brawl breaks out in Bradford city centre that left one man, 19, dead
item.description: The terrifying video shows a large group of youths brawling in the street in Bradford, with one man heard saying 'he is getting it' and 'give it to him'.

item.title: Older people are kinder than younger people and are more willing to give to charity
item.description: Women in general were found to be kinder than men, while those who perceived themselves as wealthier donated less to good causes, according to the study led by the University of Birmingham.

item.title: Airbnb crackdown in Margate over fears it's 'killing the community' due to lack of rental properties
item.description: Margate in Kent has exploded in popularity with holidaymakers in recent years thanks to its trendy bohemian vibe, with many now dubbing it 'Shoreditch on Sea.'

item.title: Mosque attack suspect, 24, shaved his head because he was infatuated with Hitler
item.description: Sam Imrie, 24, has been charged with posting statements on social media platform Telegram suggesting he was going to carry out an attack on the Fife Islamic Centre in Glenrothes, Scotland.

item.title: Man City star Benjamin Mendy, 27, is refused bail and held in prison
item.description: Mendy, 27, who has been in custody for around seven weeks, was denied bail by Judge Patrick Thompson at a 50-minute hearing at Chester Crown Court, from which the media was excluded.

item.title: Mum to the rescue! Moment lioness saves her cub from plunging down into a watering hole in Kenya
item.description: Laurent Renaud and Dominique Haution, both 62, from Douai, France, watched the cub struggle on the steep bank before the lioness came to the rescue to stop him falling backwards into the water

item.title: Leon Briggs report: Coroner says more will die unless police get better restraint training
item.description: Coroner Emma Whitting warned restraint training is dangerously inadequate eight years on from the death of Leon Briggs, who died after being restrained by Bedfordshire Police officers.

item.title: Don't call pupils' behaviour 'good' or 'bad', school headteacher says
item.description: Julian Murphy, headmaster at Loughborough Amherst School in Leicestershire, is hoping to 'take the emotional heat out of language' at the independent school for children aged four to 18.

item.title: Ministers say France WILL get £54m funding from UK for Channel migrant operation
item.description: Despite Priti Patel threatening to withhold the money unless Paris stepped up efforts to limit the flow, security minister Damian Hinds said it will be paid 'in the coming weeks.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: All hail Emperor Newsom, the woke dictator fiddling with one pointless PC policies
item.description: That the Governor of California is a shameless hypocrite is not entirely new territory. But Newsom's woke mantra is slowly wrecking a state that I love.

item.title: Son of the partner of millionaire Sir Richard Sutton, 83, admits killing him but denies murder
item.description: Thomas Schreiber, 34, pleaded guilty to the manslaughter of the wealthy 84-year-old and driving a Range Rover dangerously.

item.title: Prince Charles says he 'understands' Greta Thunberg's 'fed up' frustrations with Boris Johnson
item.description: Speaking in the gardens of his house on the Balmoral estate in Aberdeen, Prince Charles said he is 'deeply worried' about the Earth and said that humans are 'over exploiting' and damaging nature.

item.title: Gavin Newsom California governor signs law free menstrual products for girls mandates ethnic studies
item.description: California Governor Gavin Newsom has signed several notable bills into law in recent days having been buoyed after winning his recall election last month.

item.title: Future Duke of Seville Francisco de Borbón throws lavish wedding including a fireworks display
item.description: Francisco de Borbón, 43, married his bride Sophie Karoly in a lavish ceremony in Seville cathedral, with the newlyweds later partying with guests at the Marbella Club Hotel.

item.title: How Rebecca Hall's family history inspired new film Passing
item.description: British director Rebecca Hall has revealed how her family's own complex biracial history inspired her directorial debut, Passing, about two light-skinned Black women who 'pass' as white.

item.title: Paul Merson reveals he's given an allowance from his wife due to gambling
item.description: The football pundit has now disclosed that his wife Kate has to control how much money he has after he gambled away their house deposit during the coronavirus pandemic lockdown.

item.title: Demand for travel to Mexico and Thailand soars amid red list changes
item.description: After the update last Thursday, flight booking website Skyscanner said its traffic that evening was up 60 per cent in the following three hours, compared to the same time the previous week.

item.title: Samuel Aitken, 18, signs to modelling agency after walking Lady Kitty down the aisle
item.description: South African modelling agency 20 Model Management shared the news online by posting a snap of Samuel Aitken, 18, online, alongside the caption: 'The quintessential Prince.'

item.title: Charles sparks hilarious reaction with bizarre revelation that his car runs on CHEESE and white WINE
item.description: Speaking to the BBC at Balmoral, Charles explained how he had his classic blue 1970 Aston Martin converted so it runs on 'surplus English white wine' and whey from cheese production.

item.title: Shoal me love! Hundreds of fish form a heart shape in stunning drone footage
item.description: Paul Dabill, 47, captured a school of crevalle jack form a heart in the ocean off Juno Beach in Florida. The striking aerial footage shows the group of fish make a perfect love heart before dispersing.

item.title: Little Mix's Leigh-Anne Pinnock shocks as she 'slams Jesy Nelson in leaked messages'
item.description: The exchange sees messages allegedly sent between Leigh-Anne, 30, and influencer No Hun, with singer Leigh-Anne seemingly accusing Jesy of blocking her former Little Mix bandmates.

item.title: Greenpeace campaigners erect 12ft oil-spattered statue of Boris Johnson at Downing Street
item.description: Greenpeace says it is protesting against the impending approval of the new oilfield in Cambo, off the coast of the Shetland Islands.

item.title: OnlyFans model who says God encourages her to strip online slammed for 'degrading Christian faith'
item.description: Nikita Marie, 45, from Colorado, has claimed to make £1.3million a year selling X-rated pictures of herself but says that God has encouraged her to 'celebrate her body and sexuality'.

item.title: Donald Neilson was 'evil' but 'not mad' when he kept Leslie Whittle, 17, captive in a drain
item.description: Leslie Whittle was forced to climb down a metal ladder into a dark, putrid drain while masked kidnapper Donald Neilson - known as The Black Panther - held a gun to her head in 1975.

item.title: Mosques in Cologne will begin broadcasting call to prayer every Friday
item.description: All 35 mosques in Cologne will now be permitted to broadcast the call to prayer - or muezzin - for up to five minutes on Fridays between noon and 3pm, under a two-year initiative.

item.title: Army of student nurses to help out the NHS: Hospitals in Scotland called on non-registered nurses
item.description: Fully trained students awaiting registration were used as healthcare support workers on wards hit by a surge in coronavirus patients.

item.title: Britain will enjoy one last blast of sunshine with 63F heat - before temperatures plunge
item.description: Much of England will enjoy periods of glorious sunshine for the rest of this week, with the above average temperatures set to remain until Sunday, Met Office weather forecasters say.

item.title: Terrifying moment furious driver PUNCHES woman's wing mirror in front of her screaming children
item.description: Video footage has emerged on Twitter of a man punching a woman's wing mirror on the A13 in East London following a minor collision between their two cars.

item.title: Police rescue dognapped French bulldog hours after he was snatched before reuniting him with owner
item.description: Moxley, a four-month-old French bulldog, was taken during a break-in in Kings Norton, Birmingham, on January 17. Newly released video shows officers finding the dog hours after he was taken. snatched.

item.title: Tyson Fury takes his post-fight celebrations to the pool
item.description: The heavyweight champion joined guests at the Wet Republic pool party in Las Vegas after partying late into the night following his emphatic win.

item.title: Father of Molly Russell slams Facebook's safeguarding announcement
item.description: Ian Russell, of Harrow, North West London, set up a suicide prevention charity after his 14-year-old daughter killed herself in 2017 after viewing disturbing content on the company's Instagram app.

item.title: Parent is slammed for feeding vegan friend's daughter, 12, meat in secret
item.description: An anonymous woman, believed to be from the US, took to Reddit where she revealed that she feeds her vegan friend's daughter meat in secret.

item.title: Chris Packham says he knows identities of attackers after thugs torched Land Rover outside home
item.description: The BBC Springwatch presenter - an avid environmentalist and animal rights campaigner - was targeted on Friday night by balaclava-clad thugs who torched a Land Rover outside his home.

item.title: Steve Coogan transforms into paedophile Jimmy Savile to film controversial BBC series The Reckoning
item.description: Steve Coogan was pictured wearing a jester outfit on Monday as he filmed scenes in character as Jimmy Savile for controversial new series, The Reckoning.

item.title: Prince Charles reveals he named the autumn garden at Balmoral after Prince George
item.description: The future king, 72, revealed the sweet gesture as he spoke to the BBC in a wide-ranging interview. He said he built the arboretum and planted trees the year his first grandson was born.

item.title: Met Police needs to put more bobbies on the beat instead of stop and search to prevent knife crime
item.description: The centre-right Policy Exchange report criticised the Met's 'unusual and unjustified strategy' of using stop and search rather than target high-profile drug traffickers.

item.title: Art: AI recreates painting of a hidden nude that lies beneath one of Picasso's existing masterpieces
item.description: The one-off replica of Picasso's 'The Lonesome Crouching Nude' will ensure the work is no longer 'erased from history', the team from University College London said.

item.title: Panic buying is back! Shoppers queue to fill up trolleys with toilet roll and other essentials
item.description: Panic-buyers queued outside a Costco store in Manchester to stock up on goods including toilet roll as the ONS said one in six adults have been unable to buy essential food items in the last two weeks.

item.title: Met Police forensic scientist, 41, will stand trial over claims she mishandled lab evidence
item.description: Ursula Collins, from Mitcham, south London, is accused of eight offences, which are alleged to have taken place between 2009 and 2018.

item.title: Rishi Sunak 'planning to recycle IMF cash into UK aid budget'
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak is facing criticism over plans to 'recycle' a windfall from the International Monetary Fund into the UK's aid budget.

item.title: TUI holidaymaker, 58, LOSES £29,000 payout after contracting violent stomach bug
item.description: Peter Griffiths, 58, sued holiday giant TUI after he was struck down by stomach cramps, fever and diarrhoea while staying at the Aqua Fantasy Aqua Park Hotel and Spa in Turkey in 2014.

item.title: Mother-of-four, 26, who crashed her Mercedes is cleared of drink-driving
item.description: Kelsey Ridings, 26, celebrated outside Tameside Magistrates Court after she was cleared of drink-driving by claiming she had 'necked' two glasses of vodka to 'calm herself down' after.

item.title: Parents of 12-day-old baby mauled to death by dog will stand trial
item.description: Abigail Ellis, 28, and Stephen Joynes, 36, from Doncaster, appeared at Sheffield Crown Court today over the death of their son Elon Jase Ellis-Joynes in September last year.

item.title: Billie Eilish sees streams of her No Time To Die theme song PLUMMET
item.description: Streams of Billie Eilish's theme song for the latest James Bond instalment No Time To Die have plummeted, according to reports.

item.title: Prince Andrew is seen for first time after Met Police DROPPED probe
item.description: The 61-year-old Duke of York, who lives at Royal Lodge in Windsor, was photographed behind the wheel of his Range Rover this morning following the latest dramatic development in the case.

item.title: Pictured: The Belmond British Pullman train carriage redesigned by film director Wes Anderson
item.description: Wes Anderson, known for his signature symmetrical lines, unique colour palettes and Art Nouveau style, has reimagined the Belmond Pullman's 'Cygnus' carriage. Here's a peek inside...

item.title: Experts identify oldest footprints of pre-humans in Crete
item.description: Around 50 of the track marks were identified near the village of Trachilos on the western edge of the Greek island of Crete back in 2002. Now, researchers have dated them to 6.05 million years old.

item.title: Mars: Six astronauts are spending four weeks on a fake 'Red Planet' in Israel's Negev Desert
item.description: While the crew, equipment and accommodation are in Israel, hosted by the Israel Space Agency, they will all be managed by 'mission control' at the Austrian Space Forum facility in Innsbruck, Austria.

item.title: Healthy who mum suffered rare psychotic episode week after giving birth warns other parents of signs
item.description: Katherine Shaw, 31, from Shrewsbury, Shropshire, thought she would trigger a Noah's Ark flood by flushing the toilet, and that tapping or rubbing her hands would slow down time.

item.title: Did NEANDERTHALS once live on Princess Diana's childhood estate?
item.description: Pieces of worked sea shell found at Althorp Park, in Northamptonshire, were thought to be from the Middle Ages but carbon dating has revealed that they are more than 40,000 years old.

item.title: Florida trooper dodges an out-of-control pick-up truck as he helps stranded driver with a blown tire
item.description: State Trooper Dominic Alexandre, 23, narrowly avoided being run over by a silver pick-up when it crashed into an SUV on Interstate 95, Florida. The SUV driver escaped with minor injuries.

item.title: Russian spy commanders accused of beating and sexually abusing soldiers
item.description: Oleg Panov, commander of a GRU squadron in Russia's Far East, and his deputy Alexander Yerushevich, have been arrested and accused of serious physical and sexual violence.

item.title: Sebastian Kurz is just the latest EU leader to resign over corruption claims in the last decade
item.description: Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz has joined a list of European leaders who resigned as a result of corruption claims made against them, including two related to the murder of journalists.

item.title: Prince Andrew has become 'isolated' from the Royal Family, editor claims
item.description: Royal expert Russell Myers, told ITV's Lorraine the Firm are 'closing ranks' on Prince Andrew, and are angry at his attempt to use the Duke of Edinburgh's death to step back into public favour.

item.title: Fitness instructor, 34, reveals how people mistake her boyfriend, 24, for her SON
item.description: Janine Adamson, 34, from Southampton, had fancied neighbour Owen Roundell-Prince, 24, for five years before they got together during the first lockdown last year.

item.title: Academics accuse Oxford's Oriel College of depicting Cecil Rhodes as the 'devil incarnate'
item.description: Academics have slammed Oxford's Oriel for pandering to Left-wing statue topplers by erecting a plaque which depicts imperialist Cecil Rhodes as the 'devil incarnate' and 'distorts' history.

item.title: Activist arrested at Sarah Everard vigil has not made complaint about officer approaches on Tinder
item.description: Patsy Stevenson, 28, who was photographed being pinned to the ground by two officers at the vigil in March, claimed she was 'liked' by 50 uniformed police officers on the dating app.

item.title: Woman in her 20s is 'raped by a stranger in a churchyard'
item.description: Thames Valley Police said a woman in her 20s was allegedly raped by an Asian man in his 30s in the grounds of St Mary's Church in Aylesbury town centre between 5.30am and 6.15am on Sunday.

item.title: Men in the wealthiest areas of England 'now live 10 YEARS longer than those in the poorest'
item.description: King's Fund found that men in Westminster lived for 84.7 years on average by 2020. But in Blackpool they were expected to live 74 years on average. This was likely a reflection of economic divides.

item.title: Mary Berry's Best Home Cook 'set for the chop' after production company that made it went bust
item.description: Mary Berry's television show Best Home Cook is set for the chop after the production company that made it went bust.

item.title: Couple spend £4,000 to transform their home back to the 1970's.
item.description: Kyrie Jagger, 33, and her partner Andy Phillips, 38, have spent £4,000 transforming their home in Bristol back to the 1970's - and even their wardrobe fits in with the era.

item.title: Pets weight loss: amazing photos show animal transformations
item.description: This adorable Bored Panda gallery of photos from around the world shows off some truly paw-some pet transformations after animals were put on diets by their owners.

item.title: Parents blast gendered slogan clothing saying it's harmful to girls and boys
item.description: Sainsbury's was blasted on the British parenting website Mumsnet, with parents claiming that 'nothing is going to change for women while girls are still targeted with this b*******?'

item.title: NHS Covid passports compulsory in Wales TODAY
item.description: The move means all over-18s in Wales need an NHS Covid Pass or show their vaccination status to enter nightclubs and indoor non-seated events for more than 500 people, such as concerts or conventions.

item.title: Mum forks out £23,000 on a mummy makeover for her 40th birthday
item.description: Angharad Binns, from Stevenage, Hertfordshire, began saving for a gastric bypass aged 35 as she was 'fed up' with her 21st 7lbs frame. She is now a healthy nine stone.

item.title: The foods you can freeze now to get ready for Christmas
item.description: Speaking to FEMAIL, top chefs from across the country revealed the best way to cook your festive feast now, revealing that you should cook the turkey rather than freezing it whole.

item.title: Equity release borrowers urged to see if they can switch deals and save
item.description: The number of equity release mortgage holders switching to a better interest rate dropped dramatically this year, with brokers saying many are not even aware that they can move to a new plan.

item.title: Why must I wait until seven months after I am 66 for a state pension?
item.description: My birthday is in October and I reach my 67th birthday in 2027. On my Government pension page it states I can claim my state pension in May 2028. I do not understand why I have to wait.

item.title: Horse and dogs are brought to owner's hospice death bed to say goodbye
item.description: Jan Holman, 68, from Cheshire spent four weeks at the Hospice of the Good Shephard in Chester where she was desperately missed her King Charles Spaniels and horse.

item.title: People share hilarious pictures of children stealing the show
item.description: Photos from around the world capturing youngsters looking cute but causing mayhem have been shared to trivia website The Chive.com.

item.title: Could the return to work be damaging YOUR skin?
item.description: Leading skincare experts have revealed the problems that could occur while returning to the office after months at home, from irritated skin to clogged pores and premature ageing.

item.title: Negin Mirsalehi: The secret to bouncy, healthy hair
item.description: The beauty entrepreneur behind a hugely popular haircare brand has spilled the secrets behind her effortlessly bouncy locks - and the honey-infused oil she swears by all year long.

item.title: Tattoo studio mocks young boys flexing in front of their tinted windows
item.description: The amusing moment teenagers hold a 'flex off' in front of a tinted glass shopfront window without realising the store is full of people has been shared online.

item.title: Beauty and style guru Trinny Woodall reveals the secrets to her youthful complexion at 58
item.description: For decades, English style and beauty icon Trinny Woodall has built up a legion of fans who swoon over her style advice and charismatic DIY tutorials - be it on TV or more recently, live streams.

item.title: Now THAT'S a brush with death! Heron has lucky escape after three foxes eye it up for dinner
item.description: Slinking up to a riverbank, these three wily foxes gaze greedily at what they hope is a nice hearty dinner. The heron perched just feet away is searching for its own supper from the River Dodder in Dublin.

item.title: Real estate agent faces $250,000 bill over missed apostrophe on Facebook
item.description: Late on the night of October 22 last year, Anthony Zadravic posted that another real estate agent was 'selling multi million $ (sic) homes in Pearl Beach but can't pay his employees super'.
